utterance.speaker: Joey

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's not true! I wanted to wear my bathrobe and eat peanut clusters all day. I wanted to start drinking in the morning. Don't say that I don't have goals!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler, you have to start getting over her. All right, if you play, you get some fresh air, maybe it'll take your mind off Janice, and if you don't play, everyone will be mad at you 'cause the teams won't be even. Come on.

utterance.content: Yeah, all right, I'll play.

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, every, every Thanksgiving um, we used to have a touch football game called the 'Geller Bowl.'

utterance.content: No, no, no, you say that proudly.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Anyway, Ross and I were always captains, and um, it got kind've competitive and one year, Geller Bowl VI, I accidentally broke Ross's nose.

utterance.content: It was soo not an accident. She saw I was about to tag her, so she threw her big fat grandma arm elbow right into my face. And just keep running.

utterance.content: To score the winning touchdown, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, ho, ho, ho, you did not win the game, the touchdown didn't count, because of the spectacularly illegal, oh and by the way savage nose breaking.

utterance.content: I won the game.

utterance.speaker: Ross

utterance.content: Um, there was a Geller Cup?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, it was the trophy you got if you won the game. But our Dad said, 'nobody won that game, ' and he was sick of our fighting, so he took the trophy and.... threw it in the lake.

utterance.content: And was the curse lifted?

utterance.content: Anyway. That's when our Mom said we were not to play football ever again.

utterance.content: Y'know what, I think we should play a game. I mean come on, it's been twelve years.

utterance.content: We should defiantly play football more often. Maybe there's a like league we could join or something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Isn't there a national football league.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, there is, they play on Sundays and Monday nights.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh shoot! I work Monday nights.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, this stuffing is amazing. Do you think we should bring them some?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: When they're hungry enough, they'll come in.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! You let go!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How come it's always us left in the field holding the ball?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know. I guess the other people just don't care enough.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! It's starting to snow.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Gimme the this!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let go!
